intro: Pentabothra nana, commonly known as the dwarf pentabothra, is a small herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
